top_comments_top.body:
Hello and welcome to r/LifeProTips!

Please help us decide if this post is a good fit for the subreddit by up or downvoting this comment. 

If you think that this is great advice to improve your life, please upvote. If you think this doesn't help you in any way, please downvote. If you don't care, leave it for the others to decide.
In WI it's the law. If your windshield wipers are on, your headlights need to be on too.
One very foggy morning i flashed my lights at an oncoming car to remind them. They actually took the time to roll down their window to give me the finger.
I just always keep my lights on if my car is on. A great habit to get into.

In WI it's the law. If your windshield wipers are on, your headlights need to be on too.

It’s weird to me now that places don’t have running lights. In Canada, running lights are the law, there are normally low beams, but some cars have other lights, on all the time. 

It’s exactly really weird when you see a car even in on a nice sunny day without any lights on.

Lights on makes you more visible and easier to see in basically all driving conditions.
One very foggy morning i flashed my lights at an oncoming car to remind them. They actually took the time to roll down their window to give me the finger.
